node.title: Markup: Image Alignment
node.excerpt: Welcome to image alignment! The best way to demonstrate the ebb and flow of the various image positioning options is to nestle them snuggly among an ocean of words. Grab a paddle and let’s get started. On the topic of alignment, it should be noted […]

node.title: Markup: Text Alignment
node.excerpt: Default This is a paragraph. It should not have any alignment of any kind. It should just flow like you would normally expect. Nothing fancy. Just straight up text, free flowing, with love. Completely neutral and not picking a side or sitting on the fence. […]

node.title: Template: More Tag
node.excerpt: This content is before the more tag. Right after this sentence should be a “continue reading” button of some sort.

node.title: Template: Excerpt (Defined)
node.excerpt: This is a user-defined post excerpt. It should be displayed in place of the post content in archive-index pages.

node.title: Template: Excerpt (Generated)
node.excerpt: This is the post content. It should be displayed in place of the auto-generated excerpt in single-page views. Archive-index pages should display an auto-generated excerpt of this content. Depending on Theme-defined filters, the length of the auto-generated excerpt will vary from Theme-to-Theme. The default length […]

node.title: Media: Twitter Embeds
node.excerpt: Really cool to read through and find so much awesomeness added to WordPress 3.6 while I was gone. I should take three weeks off more often. — Andrew Nacin (@nacin) April 3, 2013 This post tests WordPress’ Twitter Embeds feature.
